node.title: Deaths are confirmed at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois that took a direct hit.
node.alt: The partially collapsed Amazon distribution center in Edwardsville, Ill.
node.description: The police said they were notifying next of kin after a tornado caused “catastrophic damage to a significant portion” of the building.
node.content: ["The police in Edwardsville, Ill., said there were \u201cconfirmed fatalities\u201d at an Amazon warehouse after a direct hit from a tornado caused a major portion of the building to collapse on Friday night, leaving \u201ccatastrophic damage to a significant portion\u201d of the building.", "It was not immediately known how many people had died. The police said on Saturday morning that they were notifying next of kin.", "\u201cRight now, our concern is trying to get people who are trapped,\u201d Herbert Simmons, the director of the St. Clair County Emergency Management Agency, said late Friday.", "The police did not immediately know how many workers were inside the building when the tornado struck around 8:30 p.m. Friday, but Michael Fillback, the Edwardsville police chief, told the St. Louis station KDSK-TV on Saturday morning that the number was not \u201cin the hundreds.\u201d", "Search-and-rescue operations were continuing as responders worked \u201cto ensure that everyone who was working at the time is accounted for,\u201d Chief Fillback said. A bus carried several workers to reunite with families in nearby Pontoon Beach, he said.", "The tornado caused the collapse of a wall the size of a football field at the warehouse, along with the roof above it, according to The Associated Press.", "\u201cThe safety and well-being of our employees and partners is our top priority right now,\u201d Richard Rocha, an Amazon spokesman, said in a statement on Friday night, according to The A.P. \u201cWe\u2019re assessing the situation and will share additional information when it\u2019s available.\u201d", "Amazon opened two warehouses in Edwardsville, about 25 miles east of St. Louis, in 2016, employing about 2,200 people, The St. Louis Post-Dispatch reported in 2017."]
